attributes.action: Make a public statement admitting that leaving the EU does not ‘get Brexit done’
attributes.additional_details:
Andrew Cooper - 'Voters just want Brexit over with. Whether they like it or not, it won't be':

https://www.standard.co.uk/comment/comment/andrew-cooper-voters-just-want-brexit-over-with-whether-they-like-it-or-not-it-won-t-be-a4072886.html
attributes.background: The Prime Minister has asserted that leaving the EU on 31st October will ‘get Brexit done’; when the truth is that it will mark a new phase of even longer and more complex discussions, further distracting from key domestic issues - this petition requests a formal acknowledgement of this basic fact.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

In any case, the content of any statement made by the Prime Minister, would be the responsibility of the PM and not the UK Government or Parliament.
